description:
power loss of a component with losses proportional to I² during the state under load at maximum possible continuous rms current (=  rated current) and  measured at rated ambient temperature and at rated frequency.
1 The power loss includes the losses of all current carrying paths of the component
2 The power loss curve under variable load can be expressed by the formula P= bI² with b as constant. 
3 The total load loss curve  including  no-load loss (constant a) and the variable load loss can be expressed by the formula P=a+bI² .
intermediate power loss at different load currents can be mathematically derived.
